title: Catching Up With Paras #16
body:
How do you like the NFT Drops so far? After our partnership with GalaxyOnline, we introduce our next NFT Drops with the one and only, OP Games. [If you haven’t seen the news, you can visit “The Pioneers” announcement article](https://paras.id/publication/editorial/paras-x-op-games-nft-drops-the-pioneers-60b240873ddf5f3a052f1d61).

This collaboration with OP Games is a part of the NFTs expansion project. Instead of purchasing just an NFTs, collectors buy a “part” of the game. Created by passionate developers, these games are the symbol of giving and building a community-owned game that will be powered by the creators and players.

> *Own the games and shape the future*

OP Games is also giving away 500 “Classic Snake Games” to everyone. You just need to follow [these simple instructions](https://twitter.com/Outplay_Games/status/1399032806714462210). Win it away!

Let’s get back to our weekly report. Our GMV increases from the prior week. We record $14769 in sales volume. On a side note, 445 transactions happened last week. Our artists also minted 298 new cards for collectors to collect. We still are committed to bringing more events to the platform. Don’t miss it and thank you for your hard work.

In this week’s “Catching Up with Paras”, we will talk about another 5 noteworthy collections. Unfortunately, we cannot list all the minted cards for this week, so we encourage you to discover others that are as good as this list. If you have input and suggestions, we welcome them with open arms and we want you to hit us up on [Twitter ](https://twitter.com/ParasHQ)or our [Discord ](https://discord.gg/MjC7aqz8)channel.

Without further ado, Let’s start!

# Lighthouse

> *Let the light from the Lighthouse; let it shine on me!*

Saleh brings out the “[Lighthouse](https://paras.id/saleh.near/collection/Lighthouse)” as his debut on Paras commences. The “Lighthouse” is a limited edition NFTs collectibles that can be collectors here on Paras. There are [three types of lighthouses](https://paras.id/saleh.near/collection/Lighthouse) that you can collect. It doesn’t stop there as Saleh makes sure that the art you own can be verified through Verisart. Therefore, each card has its certificate of authenticity. Saleh also includes several quotations regarding a lighthouse that hopefully enrich the collection. Come and collect your lighthouse!

 
 

# Homoludens

Asepnurdinn introduces his next collection called “[Homoludens](https://paras.id/asepnurdinn.near/collection/homoludens)”. Taken its inspiration from cultural theorists from Dutch, the collection explores the concept of humans who played as players in a world that is a game. The concept is essential to cultural development. Asepnurdinn shares this concept through expressive doodle art. Collect the “[Homoludens](https://paras.id/asepnurdinn.near/collection/homoludens)” now! What’s your human activity?

 
 

# Warrior Primates

After his debut with “[The Boogie Men](https://paras.id/artofjim.near/collection/The%20Boogie%20Men)”, Artofjim steps up by releasing his next project called “[Warrior Primates](https://paras.id/artofjim.near/collection/Warrior%20Primates)”. Currently, the collection consists of two cards only, but we should expect more to come from the artist. The two cards are “[Kamikaze Macaque](https://paras.id/token/bafybeig7faqyv45gakzhoaoc6v2e7vitctk6q3w4x4tsruqosithr5tfnm)” and “[Kamikaze Katauta](https://paras.id/token/bafybeiejzi5tw5hlhcfitpua66arbt7vwkkzx2eo6p52m3gtggofesqvie)”. The theme of the collection revolves around world war II. In the description of the card, Artofjim includes the series and the rarity of the card. What will be the epic closing for the collection? I guess we will see it together. Get your “W[arrior Primates](https://paras.id/artofjim.near/collection/Warrior%20Primates)” now!

 
 

# Alive Creeportraits

What do you think your paintings do when you fell asleep? It smiles and turns alive creepily; well, at least the one from Anftimatter did. The “[Alive Creeportraits](https://paras.id/anftimatter.near/collection/Alive%20Creeportraits)” is the new collection from the artist. It depicts several people in the frame that alive when nobody notices. The animation of these cards is simple yet superb. It brings uneasiness when you look at them. Don’t stare too long though, we don’t know if they can reach out to you yet. Let us know by owning your creepy portraits now!

 
 

# Hanafuda May

If May have a color, what would it be? I bet it is the color of Benhaley’s “Hanafuda May” collection. Benhaley continues the collection that started back in February. Each card is made of polymer clay and painted. Similar to its predecessors, there are four Hanafuda cards available for each month: [Tane](https://paras.id/token/bafybeicrsia6ledllvt46tcclmfhwft7apoe7nh4xypj3rvrq4isesdm6i), [Tanzaku](https://paras.id/token/bafybeicaw4hnfzyspipu2bfwho3aixs3ifrggvjnwx7fj74khg4h2rndx4), [Kasu 2](https://paras.id/token/bafybeiamrtt7ly6tyacabf56gwjf2ldzqngy3gjiaqgcricijrgdtu2uqu), [Kasu 1](https://paras.id/token/bafybeidbmaoqh2s7ll6gh4s6guoajb63pwxcrnnkqo6x65iby4t7of26xa). Collect this month’s Hanafuda!

That’s all for this week’s recap. How do you feel about these releases? I guess there will be a lot of cards to collect and collection that will put us on the edge of our seats.

We also would like to remind you that this month will be filled with events, so brace yourself for multiple amazing projects. If you manage to grab them, don’t forget to mention them to the artist. Remember, there are more collections to come. There will be more artists to look out for. Cheers!

title: Trade relations
body:
China became the world's largest trading nation in 2013, as measured by the sum of imports and exports, as well as the world's biggest commodity importer. comprising roughly 45% of maritime's [dry-bulk market](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shipping_markets).[\[230\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/China#cite_note-248)[\[231\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/China#cite_note-249) By 2016, China was the largest trading partner of 124 other countries.[\[232\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/China#cite_note-250) China is the largest trading partner for the [ASEAN](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ASEAN) nations, with a total trade value of $345.8 billion in 2015 accounting for 15.2% of ASEAN's total trade.[\[233\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/China#cite_note-251) ASEAN is also China's largest trading partner.[\[234\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/China#cite_note-252) In 2020, China became the largest trading partner of the [European Union](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/European_Union) for goods, with the total value of goods trade reaching nearly $700 billion.[\[235\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/China#cite_note-qz_EU_trade-253) China, along with ASEAN, Japan, South Korea, Australia and New Zealand, is a member of the [Regional Comprehensive Economic Partnership](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Regional_Comprehensive_Economic_Partnership), the world's largest free-trade area covering 30% of the world's population and economic output.[\[236\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/China#cite_note-254) China became a member of the [World Trade Organization](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Trade_Organization) (WTO) in 2001. In 2004, it proposed an entirely new [East Asia Summit](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/East_Asia_Summit) (EAS) framework as a forum for regional security issues.[\[237\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/China#cite_note-Ref_s-255) The EAS, which includes [ASEAN Plus Three](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ASEAN_Plus_Three), India, Australia and New Zealand, held its inaugural summit in 2005.[\[238\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/China#cite_note-256)

China has had a long and complex trade relationship with the United States. In 2000, the [United States Congress](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_Congress) approved "permanent normal trade relations" (PNTR) with China, allowing Chinese exports in at the same low tariffs as goods from most other countries.[\[239\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/China#cite_note-257) China has a significant [trade surplus](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Trade_surplus) with the United States, its most important export market.[\[240\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/China#cite_note-258) In the early 2010s, US politicians argued that the [Chinese yuan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chinese_yuan) was significantly undervalued, giving China an unfair trade advantage.[\[241\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/China#cite_note-259)[\[242\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/China#cite_note-CurrencyManipulator-260)[\[243\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/China#cite_note-261)\[*[needs update](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikipedia:Manual_of_Style/Dates_and_numbers#Chronological_items)*\]

Since the turn of the century, China has followed a policy of [engaging with African nations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Involvement_of_the_People%27s_Republic_of_China_in_Africa) for trade and bilateral co-operation;[\[244\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/China#cite_note-262)[\[245\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/China#cite_note-263)[\[246\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/China#cite_note-264) in 2019, Sino-African trade totalled $208 billion, having grown 20 times over two decades.[\[247\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/China#cite_note-265) According to Madison Condon "China finances more infrastructure projects in Africa than the World Bank and provides billions of dollars in low-interest loans to the continent’s emerging economies."[\[248\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/China#cite_note-266) China maintains extensive and highly diversified trade links with the European Union.[\[235\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/China#cite_note-qz_EU_trade-253) China has furthermore strengthened its trade ties with major South American economies,[\[249\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/China#cite_note-267) and is the largest trading partner of Brazil, Chile, Peru, Uruguay, Argentina, and several others.[\[250\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/China#cite_note-268)

Plan of the [Silk Road](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Silk_Road)

China's [Belt and Road Initiative](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Belt_and_Road_Initiative) has expanded significantly over the last six years and, as of April 2020, includes 138 countries and 30 international organizations. In addition to intensifying foreign policy relations, the focus here is particularly on building efficient transport routes. The focus is particularly on the [maritime Silk Road](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/21st_Century_Maritime_Silk_Road) with its connections to East Africa and Europe and there are Chinese investments or related declarations of intent at numerous ports such as [Gwadar](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gwadar), [Kuantan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kuantan), [Hambantota](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hambantota), [Piraeus](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Piraeus) and [Trieste](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Trieste). However many of these loans made under the Belt and Road program are unsustainable and China has faced a number of calls for [debt relief](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Debt_relief) from debtor nations.

title: Cultivars
body:
There are more than 7,500 known [cultivars](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cultivar) (cultivated varieties) of apples.[\[44\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Apple#cite_note-Elzebroek-44) Cultivars vary in their [yield](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Crop_yield) and the ultimate size of the tree, even when grown on the same [rootstock](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rootstock).[\[45\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Apple#cite_note-England-45) Different cultivars are available for [temperate](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Temperate) and [subtropical](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Subtropical) climates. The UK's National Fruit Collection, which is the responsibility of the Department of Environment, Food, and Rural Affairs, includes a collection of over 2,000 cultivars of apple tree in Kent.[\[46\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Apple#cite_note-46) The University of Reading, which is responsible for developing the UK national collection database, provides access to search the national collection. The University of Reading's work is part of the European Cooperative Programme for Plant Genetic Resources of which there are 38 countries participating in the Malus/Pyrus work group.[\[47\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Apple#cite_note-47)

The UK's national fruit collection database contains much information on the characteristics and origin of many apples, including alternative names for what is essentially the same "genetic" apple cultivar. Most of these cultivars are bred for eating fresh (dessert apples), though some are cultivated specifically for cooking ([cooking apples](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cooking_apple)) or producing [cider](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cider). [Cider apples](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cider_apple) are typically too tart and astringent to eat fresh, but they give the beverage a rich flavor that dessert apples cannot.[\[48\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Apple#cite_note-apples1-48)

Commercially popular apple cultivars are soft but crisp. Other desirable qualities in modern commercial apple breeding are a colorful skin, absence of [russeting](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russet_apple), ease of shipping, lengthy storage ability, high yields, disease resistance, common apple shape, and developed flavor.[\[45\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Apple#cite_note-England-45) Modern apples are generally sweeter than older cultivars, as popular tastes in apples have varied over time. Most North Americans and Europeans favor sweet, subacid apples, but tart apples have a strong minority following.[\[49\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Apple#cite_note-World-49) Extremely sweet apples with barely any acid flavor are popular in Asia,[\[49\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Apple#cite_note-World-49) especially the [Indian Subcontinent](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Indian_Subcontinent).[\[48\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Apple#cite_note-apples1-48)

Old cultivars are often oddly shaped, russeted, and grow in a variety of textures and colors. Some find them to have better flavor than modern cultivars,[\[50\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Apple#cite_note-Crops_&_Gardening_-_Apples_of_Antiquity-50) but they may have other problems that make them commercially unviable—low yield, disease susceptibility, poor tolerance for storage or transport, or just being the "wrong" size. A few old cultivars are still produced on a large scale, but many have been preserved by home gardeners and farmers that sell directly to local markets. Many unusual and locally important cultivars with their own unique taste and appearance exist; apple conservation campaigns have sprung up around the world to preserve such local cultivars from extinction. In the United Kingdom, old cultivars such as '[Cox's Orange Pippin](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cox%27s_Orange_Pippin)' and '[Egremont Russet](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Egremont_Russet)' are still commercially important even though by modern standards they are low yielding and susceptible to disease.

title: Environment
body:
In the early 2000s, China has suffered from [environmental deterioration and pollution](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Environmental_issues_in_China) due to its rapid pace of industrialisation.[\[164\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/China#cite_note-Ma2002-180)[\[165\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/China#cite_note-181) While regulations such as the 1979 Environmental Protection Law are fairly stringent, they are poorly enforced, as they are frequently disregarded by local communities and government officials in favor of rapid economic development.[\[166\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/China#cite_note-182) China is the country with the second highest death toll because of air pollution, after [India](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Environmental_issues_in_India). There are approximately 1 million deaths caused by exposure to ambient air pollution.[\[167\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/China#cite_note-183)[\[168\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/China#cite_note-184) Although China ranks as the highest [CO2 emitting](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_countries_by_carbon_dioxide_emissions) country in the world,[\[169\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/China#cite_note-185) it only emits 8 tons of [CO2 per capita](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_countries_by_carbon_dioxide_emissions_per_capita), significantly lower than developed countries such as the [United States](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States) (16.1), Australia (16.8) and South Korea (13.6).[\[170\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/China#cite_note-:3-186)

In recent years, China has clamped down on pollution. In March 2014, CCP General Secretary [Xi Jinping](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Xi_Jinping) "declared war" on pollution during the opening of the [National People's Congress](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/National_People%27s_Congress).[\[171\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/China#cite_note-largefines-187) After extensive debate lasting nearly two years, the parliament approved a new environmental law in April. The new law empowers environmental enforcement agencies with great punitive power and large fines for offenders, defines areas which require extra protection, and gives independent environmental groups more ability to operate in the country.\[*[citation needed](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikipedia:Citation_needed)*\] In 2020, Chinese Communist Party general secretary [Xi Jinping](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Xi_Jinping) announced that China aims to peak emissions before 2030 and go carbon-neutral by 2060 in accordance with the [Paris climate accord](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Paris_climate_accord).[\[172\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/China#cite_note-188)According to [Climate Action Tracker](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Climate_Action_Tracker), if accomplished it would lower the expected rise in global temperature by 0.2 - 0.3 degrees - "the biggest single reduction ever estimated by the Climate Action Tracker".[\[173\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/China#cite_note-189) In September 2021 [Xi Jinping](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Xi_Jinping) announced that China will not build "coal-fired power projects abroad". The decision can be "pivotal" in reducing emissions. The [Belt and Road Initiative](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Belt_and_Road_Initiative) did not include financing such projects already in the first half of 2021.[\[174\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/China#cite_note-190)

The country also had significant [water pollution](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Water_pollution) problems: 8.2% of China's rivers had been polluted by industrial and agricultural waste in 2019.[\[175\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/China#cite_note-191)[\[176\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/China#cite_note-192) China had a 2018 [Forest Landscape Integrity Index](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Forest_Landscape_Integrity_Index) mean score of 7.14/10, ranking it 53rd globally out of 172 countries.[\[177\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/China#cite_note-FLII-Supplementary-193) In 2020, a sweeping law was passed by the Chinese government to protect the ecology of the [Yangtze River](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yangtze_River). The new laws include strengthening ecological protection rules for hydropower projects along the river, banning chemical plants within 1 kilometer of the river, relocating polluting industries, severely restricting sand mining as well as a complete fishing ban on all the natural waterways of the river, including all its major tributaries and lakes.[\[178\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/China#cite_note-194)

China is also the world's leading investor in [renewable energy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Renewable_energy) and [its commercialization](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Renewable_energy_commercialization), with [$](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/US$)52 billion invested in 2011 alone;[\[179\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/China#cite_note-By2010-195)[\[180\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/China#cite_note-Black2010-196)[\[181\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/China#cite_note-ChinaLeadingEnergy-197) it is a major manufacturer of renewable energy technologies and invests heavily in local-scale renewable energy projects.[\[182\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/China#cite_note-bradsher-198)[\[183\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/China#cite_note-199)[\[184\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/China#cite_note-200) By 2015, over 24% of China's energy was derived from renewable sources, while most notably from [hydroelectric power](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hydroelectric_power): a total installed capacity of 197 [GW](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gigawatt) makes China the [largest hydroelectric power producer](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hydroelectricity#World_hydroelectric_capacity) in the world.[\[185\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/China#cite_note-201)[\[186\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/China#cite_note-IEA2015-202) China also has the largest power capacity of [installed solar photovoltaics system](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Solar_power_by_country) and [wind power system](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wind_power_by_country) in the world.

title: Governance on Solana (DAO 🥲)
body:
## Inventory

Solana has a built in Governance program.  As such it’s not very usable, you need UI to interact with the contract conveniently. As such there is a Mango partnered instance of frontend, but anyone could build one (cf [Squads](https://squads.medium.com/))

* a back-office web app to create and manage DAO called [Oyster]() on GH, the [UI looks like this]().
* a use-facing web app to allow access for voting and seeing governance proposals, called [governance-ui]() on GH, the [UI looks like this](). It has been built w/ Mango Market people, that’s the Mango DAO we know.

The back office does not allow the creation of DAO by anyone right now, but I imagine they have a tiny vetting process as to who can interact and getting in touch with them should allow a “listing”.

## The Governance Primitive on Solana

Below is the diagram of the governance program. I’ll go through the documentation and add some comments. This is a personal notes kind of document.

![OCD level 120% at all the non-straight boxes and arrows](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/GgoZbyTtxztDLkSE_hV2d.png?height=1451&width=1304)

## Realm Account - The top level organisation

> **Realm account** ties Community Token Mint and optional Council Token mint to create a realm for any governance pertaining to the community of the token holders. For example a trading protocol can issue a governance token and use it to create its governance realm.

This is a top level thing that is like an internal DAO for the team, it can use the governance token, or a separate TeamGovernance token. I think using the governance one is fine if you setup things manually pre IDO, else the TeamGovernance one can come handy. See the end of this doc for an example.

It represents the organisation, and from this you derive new `ProgramGovernance` instances, each of them managing ONE and only program.

## Governance Accounts - The controllers

### Program Governance Account - Program

> The basic building block of governance to update programs is the ProgramGovernance account. It ties a governed Program ID and holds configuration options defining governance rules. The governed Program ID is used as the seed for a [Program Derived Address](https://docs.solana.com/developing/programming-model/calling-between-programs#program-derived-addresses), and this program derived address is what is used as the address of the Governance account for your Program ID.
>
> What this means is that there can only ever be ONE Governance account for a given Program. The governance program validates at creation time of the Governance account that the current upgrade authority of the program taken under governance signed the transaction. Optionally `CreateProgramGovernance` instruction can also transfer `upgrade_authority` of the governed program to the Governance PDA at the creation time of the Governance account.

You deploy your program, and then transfer the authority to the governance account. (?)

This then provide an API for upgrades.

*I wonder how the upgrade goes, what are the limitations like update size if it needs to fits CPI calls?*

### Mint Governance account - Mint

> A mint governance account allows a mint authority to setup governance over an SPL Mint account. The Governance program validates at creation time that the current mint authority signed the transaction to create the governance and optionally can transfer the authority to the Governance account. Once setup the Mint Governance allows governance participants to create Proposals which execute mint instructions for the governed Mint.

Similar logic as the Program Governance Account above, except the API is tailor to cater for Minting needs.

### Token Governance account - SPL Token Account (wallet)

> A token governance account allows a token account owner to setup governance over an SPL Token account. The Governance program validates at creation time the current owner signed the transaction to create the governance and optionally can transfer the owner to the Governance account. Once setup the Token Governance allows participants to create Proposals to execute transfer instructions from the governed token account.

Similar to the PGA and MGA above, except it’s a SPL wallet API this time.

## Authority

### Proposal accounts

> A Proposal is an instance of a Governance created to vote on and execute given set of instructions. It is created by someone (Proposal Owner) and tied to a given Governance account and has a set of executable instructions to it, a name and a description. It goes through various states (draft, voting, executing, ...) and users can vote on it if they have relevant Community or Council tokens. Its rules are determined by the Governance account that it is tied to, and when it executes, it is only eligible to use the [Program Derived Address](https://docs.solana.com/developing/programming-model/calling-between-programs#program-derived-addresses) authority given by the Governance account. So a Proposal for Sushi cannot for instance upgrade the Program for Uniswap.

This is the actual Proposal submitted to the public for voting. But before it goes live… ⤵️

> When a Proposal is created by a user then the user becomes Proposal Owner and receives permission to edit the Proposal. With this power the Owner can edit the Proposal, add/remove Signatories to the Proposal and also cancel it. These Signatories can then show their approval of the Proposal by signing it off. Once all Signatories have signed off the Proposal the Proposal leaves Draft state and enters Voting state. Voting state lasts as long as the Governance has it configured to last, and during this time people holding Community (or Council) tokens may vote on the Proposal. Once the Proposal is "tipped" it either enters the Defeated or Succeeded state. If the vote can't be tipped automatically during the voting period but still reaches the required Yes vote threshold it can be manually transitioned to Succeeded state using FinalizeVote instruction. Once all Proposal instructions are executed the Proposal enters Completed state.

This explain the several stages of a proposal, it’s to prevent indirect rugs like team member X votes to transfer all the treasury to his wallet with lowest treshold and vote himself.

> In the Executing state an instruction can be run by any one at any time after the `instruction_hold_up_time` period has transpired

This is for time-lock and vesting, nice.


_____

TL:DR; for the last bits is that a `ProposalAccount` can have several `ProposalInstructions`, the actual pieces of work (send X tokens to Billy - Update the program with his patch). If that interest you I think you’ll go in [the doc]() and check the voting dynamic that I haven’t mentioned here. All what I talked about is from there anyway.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/06rBmfJZt-Fh0Enc8H2W5.png?height=1490&width=1775)

## Respect my authority, how does it all come together

So usually, a team would have control over the Program deployment, Minting of its IDO’d {gov/shit}coins, and control the wallet(s) (IDO profits, fees, community…).

This is a big responsibility, because upgrading the program on Solana means changing its behaviour silently. Any project with control of the Program Deployment can just send an TX to suck your NFT the next time you transact without doing a forensic analysis of the TX prompt if they want, and the confirmation UI/UX is not always super clear (quite good on Phantom now though)

I won’t speak about Mint and Wallet unilateral control, which is straight forward about the involved risks.


_____

To overcome that, the governance above is a great tool, the important bit being :

> Governance can handle arbitrary executions of code.

In the example above, let’s say the team delegates Program Deployment, Mint and Wallets to the DAO. Then is mean that the only way they have to interact with these is to to submit proposals and get them approved.

Let’s say they want to pay a bug bounty, then they craft the TX with the amount and in/outs, then send it to the `TokenGovernanceAccount` (not sure about the exact flow but you get the idea) and it will be there waiting to reach a treshold of vote or the timeout for the program to decide wether it should pass (be signed by it's Authority) or be rejected.

Gov token holder go on the aforementioned UI and vote with their stake. On given proposals.


______

It’s an indirection layer that prevents bamboozles, with supplementary indirection-ception.

It can feel a bit useless, as usually the teams/investors/whales own a large chunk of the tokens, and could band up to do bad things? But it’s what a governance is, people who have stake decides. That’s the base rule.

What’s valuable here is that least we got it fully transparent and immuable, thanks to the blockchain™️. We know who did what and when.

## Real world examples

### An IDO

You’r team want to do an IDO to kickstart a DAO/your governance token, you’ll need to :

* deploy programs (at least the IDO one)
* pre mint the Governance Token and store securely until next step
* allocate x% to the IDO, send the remainder into several `GovernanceTokenAccount` (community, team growth, insurance w/e)
* allocate some to vesting (time-locked transactions) for team or investors

You could do the above manually, the stake is still “low” pre IDO.

OR you could use the feature previously mentionned of `TeamGovernance tokens` from the RealAccount.

You would do kind of an internal DAO for the team to setup things, with internal valueless tokens that are just there to kick start things, maybe later on for more internal decisions, but at that stage you could use the IDO’ed governance token.

One thing that could be handy, is to have these `Community Token Mint` (*TeamGovernance token?)* behave like time-locked vested Governance token. That way it has no actual market value, but still allow the team the vote as if they had their stake.

### An existing organisation that want to transition to better practices

You’r team has a nice Defi/NFT project, things are settling down, and now you have time to consider following better practices (that should have been done in the beginning but yea anyway).

Current context :

* you control existing wallets for your treasury, usually one wallet for anything with manual management of transactions. Team members controlling the distributed/duplicated secret key (#security)
* you have a community that would like to participate in the decision making

What needs to be done :

* instantiate a Governance program stack
* do an IDO for voting, or use a token if you have one already (might also use NFT not sure)
* delegate ownership of TokenWallets and Mint and ProgramDeployment to the GovernanceProgram accounts
* start the usual DAO process, where things happen when it’s voted

## Conclusion

I think it seem very spooky for teams to loose the direct control they had, but that’s the proper way.

It remove the weight of being able to fuck up the whole thing, maliciously, by stupidity, or by being tricked. We know how elaborate these things can be and nobody is safe. The only security is Zero Trust, decentralisation.

Don’t forget that it’s not YOURs anymore once people have “invested in” by minting/IDOing etc. It’s normal that the control is shared, also the decision making. 
 

Not everybody will agree on this, but I think it’s an artefact from the old unfair real world. 
  
 Cheers thanks for reading

title: Sonny and Cher's rise to pop stardom
body:
In early 1965, Caesar and Cleo began calling themselves [Sonny & Cher](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sonny_%26_Cher).[\[27\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cher#cite_note-FOOTNOTECherCoplon199898-27) Following the recording of "[I Got You Babe](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/I_Got_You_Babe)", they traveled to England in July 1965 at [the Rolling Stones](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Rolling_Stones)' advice; Cher recalled, "\[they\] had told us ... that Americans just didn't get us and that if we were going to make it big, we were going to have to go to England."[\[28\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cher#cite_note-FOOTNOTECherCoplon1998108%E2%80%93109-28) According to writer [Cintra Wilson](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cintra_Wilson), "English newspaper photographers showed up when S&C were thrown out of the [London Hilton](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/London_Hilton_on_Park_Lane) \[because of their outfits\] the night they arrived—literally overnight, they were stars. London went gaga for the heretofore-unseen S&C look, which was neither [mod](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mod_(subculture)) nor [rocker](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mods_and_rockers)."[\[29\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cher#cite_note-CintraWilson-29)

"I Got You Babe" reached number one on the *Billboard* Hot 100 chart[\[30\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cher#cite_note-30) and became, according to AllMusic's Bruce Eder, "one of the biggest-selling and most beloved pop/rock hits of the mid-'60s";[\[18\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cher#cite_note-Eder2009-18) *[Rolling Stone](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rolling_Stone)* listed it among "[The 500 Greatest Songs of All Time](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rolling_Stone%27s_500_Greatest_Songs_of_All_Time)" in 2003.[\[31\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cher#cite_note-rs500-31) As the song knocked the Beatles off the top of the British charts, English teenagers began to emulate Sonny and Cher's fashion style, such as [bell-bottoms](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bell-bottoms), striped pants, ruffled shirts, industrial zippers and fur vests.[\[32\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cher#cite_note-FOOTNOTECherCoplon1998110%E2%80%93111-32) Upon their return to the US, the duo made several appearances on the teen-pop showcases *[Hullabaloo](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hullabaloo_(TV_series))* and *[Shindig!](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shindig!)*[\[33\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cher#cite_note-FOOTNOTECherCoplon1998114-33) and completed a tour of some of the largest arenas in the US.[\[34\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cher#cite_note-FOOTNOTEParishPitts2003149-34) Their shows attracted Cher look-alikes—"girls who were ironing their hair straight and dyeing it black, to go with their vests and bell-bottoms".[\[35\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cher#cite_note-FOOTNOTECherCoplon1998116-35) Cher expanded her creative range by designing a clothing line.[\[36\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cher#cite_note-FOOTNOTEParishPitts2003148-36)

Sonny and Cher's first album, *[Look at Us](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Look_at_Us)* (1965), released for the [Atco Records](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Atco_Records) division of [Atlantic Records](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Atlantic_Records),[\[18\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cher#cite_note-Eder2009-18) spent eight weeks at number two on the *Billboard* 200, behind the Beatles' *[Help!](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Help!)*.[\[37\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cher#cite_note-CloserToTheTruthBillboard2000-37) Their material became popular, and the duo successfully competed with the dominant [British Invasion](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/British_Invasion) and [Motown](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Motown) sounds of the era.[\[36\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cher#cite_note-FOOTNOTEParishPitts2003148-36) Author Joseph Murrells described Sonny and Cher as "part of the leading exponents of the rock-folk-message type of song, a hybrid combining the best and instrumentation of rock music with folk lyric and often lyrics of [protest](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Protest_song)."[\[38\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cher#cite_note-FOOTNOTEMurrells1978197-38) Sonny and Cher charted ten *[Billboard](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Billboard_(magazine))* top 40 singles between 1965 and 1972, including five top-ten singles: "I Got You Babe", "[Baby Don't Go](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Baby_Don%27t_Go)", "[The Beat Goes On](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Beat_Goes_On_(Sonny_%26_Cher_song))", "[All I Ever Need Is You](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/All_I_Ever_Need_Is_You_(song))", and "[A Cowboy's Work Is Never Done](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/A_Cowboy%27s_Work_Is_Never_Done)".[\[39\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cher#cite_note-39) At one point, they had five songs in the top 50 at the same time, a feat equaled only by the Beatles and [Elvis Presley](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Elvis_Presley).[\[40\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cher#cite_note-40) By the end of 1967, they had sold 40 million records worldwide and had become, according to *[Time](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Time_(magazine))* magazine's [Ginia Bellafante](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ginia_Bellafante), rock's "it" couple.[\[41\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cher#cite_note-time1998-41)

Cher's following releases kept her solo career fully competitive with her work with Sonny.[\[18\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cher#cite_note-Eder2009-18) *[The Sonny Side of Chér](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Sonny_Side_of_Ch%C3%A9r)* (1966) features "[Bang Bang (My Baby Shot Me Down)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bang_Bang_(My_Baby_Shot_Me_Down))", which reached number two in the US and number three in the UK and became her first million-seller solo single. *[Chér](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ch%C3%A9r_(1966_album))*, also released in 1966, contains the [Burt Bacharach](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Burt_Bacharach) and [Hal David](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hal_David) composition "[Alfie](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alfie_(Burt_Bacharach_song))", which was added to the credits of the American version of the 1966 [film of the same name](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alfie_(1966_film)) and became the first stateside version of the popular song. *[With Love, Chér](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/With_Love,_Ch%C3%A9r)* (1967) includes songs described by biographer [Mark Bego](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mark_Bego) as "little soap-opera stories set to rock music" such as the US top-ten single "[You Better Sit Down Kids](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/You_Better_Sit_Down_Kids)".

title: Modern history
body:
### After the war, Shanghai's economy was restored—from 1949 to 1952, the city's agricultural and industrial output increased by 51.5% and 94.2%, respectively.\[38\] There were 20 urban districts and 10 suburbs at the time.\[59\] On 17 January 1958, Jiading, Baoshan, and Shanghai County in Jiangsu became part of Shanghai Municipality, which expanded to 863 km2 (333.2 sq mi). The following December, the land area of Shanghai was further expanded to 5,910 km2 (2,281.9 sq mi) after more surrounding suburban areas in Jiangsu were added: Chongming, Jinshan, Qingpu, Fengxian, Chuansha, and Nanhui.\[60\] In 1964, the city's administrative divisions were rearranged to 10 urban districts and 10 counties.\[59\]

### As the industrial center of China with the most skilled industrial workers, Shanghai became a center for radical leftism during the 1950s and 1960s. The radical leftist Jiang Qing and her three allies, together the Gang of Four, were based in the city.\[61\] During the Cultural Revolution (1966–1976), Shanghai's society was severely damaged, with 310,000 wrongful convictions involving more than 1 million people. About 11,500 people were unjustly persecuted to death. Yet, even during the most tumultuous times of the revolution, Shanghai was able to maintain economic production with positive annual growth rate.\[38\]

### Since 1949, Shanghai has been a comparatively heavy contributor of tax revenue to the central government; in 1983, the city's contribution in tax revenue was greater than investment received in the past 33 years combined.\[62\] Its importance to the fiscal well-being of the central government also denied it from economic liberalizations begun in 1978. In 1990, Deng Xiaoping finally permitted Shanghai to initiate economic reforms, which reintroduced foreign capital to the city and developed the Pudong district, resulting in the birth of Lujiazui.\[63\] As of 2020, Shanghai is classified as an Alpha+ city by the Globalization and World Cities Research Network, making it one of the world's Top 10 major cities.\[64\]
